The overall habitat suitability of B. zonata merged climatic suitability and areas growing important host plants for the fruit fly and estimated the areas that were vulnerable to its invasion, the results are presented in
Fig 6Aâ€“6E . We noted some variability in the overall habitat suitability of B. zonata globally. The merged distribution indicated highly vulnerable areas in Asia (India, Bangladesh, Burma, Thailand, and Laos under future climatic conditions (RCP2.6, RCP 4.5, RCP6.0 and RCP8.5). In Madagascar, Angola, Mozambique, and Zambia suitable habitats were detected under RCP4.5. In Libya, Egypt, Sudan, Chad, Niger, Mali, Mauritania, Western Sahara we predicted areas less vulnerable to the potential establishment of B. zonata.
